page.title: 06Chard Junction
page.content:
The railway station at Chard Junction has been disused since the 1960s when it was closed for economic reasons. Its opening a hundred years earlier had brought trade and industry, and a good many people, to the area.
The station stands on the main railway line linking the south-west and London, and trains regularly pass through carrying passengers and freight.
The newly-modernised Milk Marketing Board factory at Chard Junction is to have railway sidings constructed so that coal for the furnaces can be delivered by rail.
There are local moves to have the station reopened for passenger trains.
